intro: Justicia maya, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Justicia maya is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
